messages.message:
Hey @Prakhar i think this looks good. Could we use % or responsive margins on the arrow column so that it moves in slightly if you make it really wide?

If the margins in general at the top could match the margins for the check list items in the bottom box, I think this would look good.

> If the margins in general at the top could match the margins for the check list items in the bottom box, I think this would look good.
This won't work because in the examples section are center aligned while the best practices are left aligned. Having the arrows in separate column  on the right will create alignment issues like @Prakhar pointed out above.

Solution could be to modify examples layout similar to best practice. i.e. A layout should arrow column followed by left aligned example prompt

Ah good point, I think the examples should stay as they are.

I think maybe just increasing the left and right margins slightly on the examples would help.
@Lee Expanded and shrinked screenshots. Does this work?
